text:
I think I've solved this one.

The issue is that I'm using Chrome Beta, and as per Google's release notes (see below), the new sameSite cookie policy is in effect on Beta.

<https://www.chromestatus.com/feature/5633521622188032>
<https://www.chromium.org/updates/same-site>

Here you can see the related errors in the console: <https://i.imgur.com/FcHuwlM.png>

I hope Dev is taking note of the change! <@U7SL518D6> Would be a nightmare if this happened to everyone once it goes live in Feb 2020.

Solution: You can disasble this feature in chrome(but I wouldn't): <https://i.imgur.com/5mcAhzV.png> or you can download and install the stable release chrome version.
Thank you for reporting this and for the troubleshooting you did to discover where this issue came from. I will let our teams know.
A fix for this is in progress, and should be out before this feature exits beta. Thank you for reporting it!
Another way we’ve done this is used hubdb and advanced menus to make descriptions. By leveraging the slug you can match to a column in hubdb and make it easy for clients to edit
